description: Part single and part two storey rear extension; single storey side extension (following demolition of existing WW2 side air raid shelter); loft conversion to habitable space; installation of four rooflights to rear and side roofslopes; replacement of windows with double glazed units to match existing; alteration to fenestration to front, side and rear elevation; and works to front garden, including reintroduction of the boundary wall
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 23ar/550/001 (Existing Ground Floor Plan); 23ar/550/002 (Existing First Floor Plan); 23ar/550/003 (Existing Loft Floor Plan); 23ar/550/004 (Existing Roof Plan); 23ar/550/005 (Existing Front Elevation); 23ar/550/006 (Existing West Facing Side Elevation); 23ar/550/007 (Existing Rear Elevation); 23ar/550/008 (Existing East Facing Side Elevation); 23ar/550/009 (Existing Front Garden Plan); 23ar/550/010 (Existing Front Boundary Elevation); 23ar/550/011 (Existing Block Plan); 23ar/550/012 (Location Plan); 23ar/550/101 Rev A (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); 23ar/550/102 Rev A (Proposed First Floor Plan); 23ar/550/103 Rev A (Proposed Second Floor Plan); 23ar/550/104 Rev A (Proposed Roof Plan); 23ar/550/105 Rev A (Proposed Front Elevation); 23ar/550/106 Rev A (Proposed West Facing Side Elevation); 23ar/550/107 Rev A (Proposed Rear Elevation); 23ar/550/108 Rev A (Proposed East Facing Side Elevation); 23ar/550/109 Rev A (Proposed Front Garden Plan); 23ar/550/110 Rev A (Proposed Front Boundary Elevation); 23ar/550/111 Rev A (Proposed Block Plan); Design and Access Statement prepared by Tim Walker Architect dated March 2022; Heritage Statement prepared by Tim Walker Architect dated March 2022; Windows and Doors Details
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3, D4, and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012).
| No part of the roof of the extensions shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| The (west) side facing windows at first floor level shall be obscure glazed non-opening unless the parts of the windows which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the windows are installed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The roof lights hereby approved shall be installed as conservation-grade roof lights only, and permanently retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies D1, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
